title: Ghostly Ballroom Adventure #40
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Ballroom
rooms.description: A magnificent but decaying ballroom with a crystal chandelier hanging precariously overhead. Ghostly music echoes through the air, and translucent figures waltz across the dusty floor. Moonlight streams through tall windows, illuminating portraits of long-dead nobility. A grand piano sits in the corner, and an ornate table stands near the entrance.

items.name: grand piano
items.description: An elegant piano covered in dust. Sheet music rests on the stand.
items.text: Sheet music title: 'The Phantom's Waltz - Composed in 1847 by Lord Ashworth'

items.name: ornate table
items.description: A decorative table with intricate carvings. It has a single drawer.

items.name: silver key
items.description: An ornate silver key with ghostly engravings

items.name: portrait of Lady Ashworth
items.description: A painting of an elegant woman in a blue gown
items.text: Lady Catherine Ashworth - Beloved wife and mistress of the manor. Her favorite place was the garden where roses bloomed eternal.

items.name: portrait of Lord Ashworth
items.description: A painting of a stern nobleman
items.text: Lord Edmund Ashworth - Master of Ashworth Manor. Known for his love of music and his devotion to his wife Catherine.

items.name: crystal chandelier
items.description: A massive chandelier that sways gently despite no breeze

items.name: ghostly letter
items.description: A translucent letter that glows with spectral energy
items.text: My dearest Catherine, I await you in the library where we spent countless evenings. Remember our wedding year, 1845, and the name of the one who holds your heart. - Edmund

items.name: double doors to gallery
items.description: Tall double doors leading to the portrait gallery

rooms.name: Portrait Gallery
rooms.description: A long hallway lined with portraits of the Ashworth family through the generations. Candles flicker in wall sconces, casting dancing shadows. A locked cabinet stands against one wall, and a glass display case holds various artifacts. A door to the west leads to the garden.

items.name: glass display case
items.description: A case displaying family heirlooms and trinkets

items.name: Ashworth family bible
items.description: An old bible with family records
items.text: Family Records: Lord Edmund Ashworth married Lady Catherine Rose in the year 1845. Their union was blessed and their love eternal.

items.name: mahogany cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with two compartments

items.name: servant's diary
items.description: A worn diary belonging to a household servant
items.text: The master and mistress were so happy together. Lady Catherine loved the rose garden more than anything. After she passed, Lord Edmund locked himself in the library, never to emerge. Some say his spirit still waits there for her.

items.name: brass garden key
items.description: A key shaped like a rose

items.name: portrait of the household staff
items.description: A group portrait of the manor's servants
items.text: The loyal staff of Ashworth Manor: Head Butler James, Cook Margaret, and Gardener Thomas who tended the roses.

items.name: door to garden
items.description: A wooden door with rose carvings leading to the garden

rooms.name: Moonlit Rose Garden
rooms.description: A hauntingly beautiful garden where ghostly roses bloom in eternal moonlight. Stone benches sit among the flower beds, and a fountain tinkles softly in the center. The ghost of Lady Catherine can be seen tending to her roses. A gate leads to the library.

items.name: stone fountain
items.description: A fountain with a statue of two lovers embracing

items.name: Catherine's letter
items.description: A letter written in elegant script
items.text: My beloved Edmund, even in death I remember our love. To join me, you must prove you know: who was I in life, where did we wed, and who tends my beloved roses now. - Your eternal Catherine

items.name: spectral rose bush
items.description: A bush of glowing ghostly roses

items.name: gardener's note
items.description: A note left by the ghostly gardener
items.text: Thomas here. The master and mistress were wed in the chapel on the grounds. Lady Catherine's maiden name was Rose, fitting for one who loved these flowers so. I tend them still, even in death.

items.name: stone bench
items.description: A weathered bench with an inscription
items.text: In memory of Catherine Rose Ashworth - Forever in our hearts

items.name: iron gate to library
items.description: An ornate iron gate with three questions etched into a brass plaque

password_questions.question: What was Lady Catherine's maiden name?
password_questions.hint: Check the garden bench inscription and the gardener's note

password_questions.question: Where were Edmund and Catherine wed?
password_questions.hint: The gardener's note mentions the wedding location

password_questions.question: Who tends the roses now?
password_questions.hint: Look for information about the gardener

rooms.name: Ashworth Library
rooms.description: A grand library filled with ancient books and the scent of old paper. The ghost of Lord Edmund sits in a chair by the fireplace, finally at peace. As you enter, both ghostly figures - Edmund and Catherine - turn to you and smile. A shimmering portal of light appears, offering escape from the haunted manor.

items.name: stone fireplace
items.description: A grand fireplace with ghostly flames that provide no heat

items.name: Lord Edmund's chair
items.description: A comfortable chair where the ghost of Lord Edmund sits, now reunited with his love

items.name: towering bookshelf
items.description: Shelves filled with leather-bound volumes

items.name: Edmund's final journal
items.description: The last journal of Lord Ashworth
items.text: I have waited so long for my Catherine. Now that someone has brought us together again by remembering our story, we can finally rest. Thank you, brave soul. You have freed us both.

rooms.win_message: The ghostly couple embraces, their forms glowing brighter and brighter until they fade into peaceful light. The curse on Ashworth Manor is broken! The ballroom music stops, and the oppressive atmosphere lifts. You have reunited the eternal lovers and freed their spirits. The manor is at peace at last. You win!
